intro: Cirrhopetalum dyerianum, commonly known as the Dyer's cirrhopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble umbrellas. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats and produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in dense, terminal spikes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
